data.name: Gary's Game - Under Fire
data.description:
# Gary's Game - Under Fire Your friend Gary is developing a shootergame and wants you to help him.
When the player is shot, a marker on his HUD should indicate the direction towards the enemy.
Since Gary uses an arrow that gets rotated to indicate that position, he needs you to find the angle (in deegrees) he has to rotate the arrow clockwise from its default rotation (pointing Upwards on the PlayerScreen). ## Return the angle (with mod 360) needed to rotate the camera clockwise to face the enemy ### Examples: 1. Player looks Enemy in the eye --> 0 degrees ```javascript getArrowAngle([0,0],[1,0],[-1,0])==0 ``` 2. Player faces directly Away from Enemy --> 180 degrees ```javascript getArrowAngle([0,0],[1,0],[1,0])==180 ``` 3. Enemy is stuck inside Player (playerPos==enemyPos) ---> -1 ```javascript getArrowAngle([0,0],[0,0],[-1,0])==-1 ``` ### Input: 1. Gary can provide you with the following: The enemy position, the player position and the camera direction 2. The Camera Direction will always be a normalized vector. 3. Player position and enemy position are x and y coordinates given to you as an array with x coming first. `[x,y]` 4. X and Y Coordinates can be positive and negative float ### Notes: 1. Your result is evaluated with an errormargin of 0.9 2. Since this is his first game, players and enemies are restricted to the xy-plane.
